channel.title: CVE Feed for Apple -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apple -- all

item.title: CVE-2024-0258|2024-03-08T01:36:10.920Z -- Apple -- tvOS
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in tvOS 17.4, iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4, macOS Sonoma 14.4, watchOS 10.4. An app may be able to execute arbitrary code out of its sandbox or with certain elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-0230|2024-01-12T23:10:45.940Z -- Apple -- Magic Keyboard Firmware Update
item.description: A session management issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in Magic Keyboard Firmware Update 2.0.6. An attacker with physical access to the accessory may be able to extract its Bluetooth pairing key and monitor Bluetooth traffic.

item.title: CVE-2024-27810|2024-05-13T23:00:55.661Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: A path handling issue was addressed with improved validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5, tvOS 17.5, watchOS 10.5, macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app may be able to read sensitive location information.

item.title: CVE-2024-27847|2024-05-13T23:00:55.278Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: This issue was addressed with improved checks This issue is fixed in iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5, macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app may be able to bypass Privacy preferences.

item.title: CVE-2024-27796|2024-05-13T23:00:54.914Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5, macOS Sonoma 14.5. An attacker may be able to elevate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-27827|2024-05-13T23:00:54.538Z -- Apple -- macOS
item.description: This issue was addressed through improved state management. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app may be able to read arbitrary files.

item.title: CVE-2024-27816|2024-05-13T23:00:54.182Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5, tvOS 17.5, watchOS 10.5, macOS Sonoma 14.5. An attacker may be able to access user data.

item.title: CVE-2024-27791|2024-04-24T16:43:44.979Z -- Apple -- macOS
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3, tvOS 17.3, macOS Ventura 13.6.4, iOS 16.7.5 and iPadOS 16.7.5, macOS Monterey 12.7.3, macOS Sonoma 14.3. An app may be able to corrupt coprocessor memory.

item.title: CVE-2024-27841|2024-05-13T23:00:53.803Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5, macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app may be able to disclose kernel memory.

item.title: CVE-2024-27821|2024-05-13T23:00:53.440Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: A path handling issue was addressed with improved validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5, watchOS 10.5, macOS Sonoma 14.5. A shortcut may output sensitive user data without consent.

item.title: CVE-2024-27837|2024-05-13T23:00:53.088Z -- Apple -- macOS
item.description: A downgrade issue was addressed with additional code-signing restrictions. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.5. A local attacker may gain access to Keychain items.

item.title: CVE-2024-27843|2024-05-13T23:00:52.361Z -- Apple -- macOS
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app may be able to elevate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-27793|2024-05-08T22:15:21.788Z -- Apple -- iTunes for Windows
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iTunes 12.13.2 for Windows. Parsing a file may lead to an unexpected app termination or arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-27818|2024-05-13T23:00:51.988Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5, macOS Sonoma 14.5. An attacker may be able to cause unexpected app termination or arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-27789|2024-05-13T23:00:51.598Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 16.7.8 and iPadOS 16.7.8, macOS Monterey 12.7.5, macOS Ventura 13.6.7, macOS Sonoma 14.4. An app may be able to access user-sensitive data.

item.title: CVE-2024-27822|2024-05-13T23:00:51.229Z -- Apple -- macOS
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app may be able to gain root privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-27834|2024-05-13T23:00:50.836Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5, tvOS 17.5, Safari 17.5, watchOS 10.5, macOS Sonoma 14.5. An attacker with arbitrary read and write capability may be able to bypass Pointer Authentication.

item.title: CVE-2024-27835|2024-05-13T23:00:50.448Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: This issue was addressed through improved state management. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5. An attacker with physical access to an iOS device may be able to access notes from the lock screen.

item.title: CVE-2024-27839|2024-05-13T23:00:50.063Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: A privacy issue was addressed by moving sensitive data to a more secure location. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5. A malicious application may be able to determine a user's current location.

item.title: CVE-2024-27803|2024-05-13T23:00:49.678Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: A permissions issue was addressed with improved validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5. An attacker with physical access may be able to share items from the lock screen.

item.title: CVE-2024-27842|2024-05-13T23:00:49.309Z -- Apple -- macOS
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-27824|2024-05-13T23:00:48.563Z -- Apple -- macOS
item.description: This issue was addressed by removing the vulnerable code. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app may be able to elevate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-27804|2024-05-13T23:00:48.211Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5, tvOS 17.5, watchOS 10.5, macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-27829|2024-05-13T23:00:47.843Z -- Apple -- macOS
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.5. Processing a file may lead to unexpected app termination or arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-27852|2024-05-13T23:00:47.471Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: A privacy issue was addressed with improved client ID handling for alternative app marketplaces. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5. A maliciously crafted webpage may be able to distribute a script that tracks users on other webpages.

item.title: CVE-2024-27813|2024-05-13T23:00:47.117Z -- Apple -- macOS
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app may be able to execute arbitrary code out of its sandbox or with certain elevated privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-27825|2024-05-13T23:00:46.750Z -- Apple -- macOS
item.description: A downgrade issue affecting Intel-based Mac computers was addressed with additional code-signing restrictions. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.5. An app may be able to bypass certain Privacy preferences.

item.title: CVE-2024-27798|2024-05-13T23:00:46.368Z -- Apple -- macOS
item.description: An authorization issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.5. An attacker may be able to elevate privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-23259|2024-03-08T01:36:21.185Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 16.7.6 and iPadOS 16.7.6, iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4, macOS Sonoma 14.4. Processing web content may lead to a denial-of-service.

item.title: CVE-2024-23218|2024-01-23T00:25:38.999Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: A timing side-channel issue was addressed with improvements to constant-time computation in cryptographic functions. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.3, watchOS 10.3, tvOS 17.3, iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3. An attacker may be able to decrypt legacy RSA PKCS#1 v1.5 ciphertexts without having the private key.

item.title: CVE-2024-23234|2024-03-08T01:36:20.258Z -- Apple -- macOS
item.description: An out-of-bounds write issue was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.4, macOS Monterey 12.7.4, macOS Ventura 13.6.5. An app may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

item.title: CVE-2024-23263|2024-03-08T01:36:19.295Z -- Apple -- visionOS
item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved validation. This issue is fixed in tvOS 17.4, macOS Sonoma 14.4, visionOS 1.1, iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4, watchOS 10.4, iOS 16.7.6 and iPadOS 16.7.6, Safari 17.4. Processing maliciously crafted web content may prevent Content Security Policy from being enforced.

item.title: CVE-2024-23275|2024-03-08T01:36:18.366Z -- Apple -- macOS
item.description: A race condition was addressed with additional validation. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.4, macOS Monterey 12.7.4, macOS Ventura 13.6.5. An app may be able to access protected user data.

item.title: CVE-2024-23222|2024-03-08T01:36:17.423Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: A type confusion issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3, macOS Sonoma 14.3, tvOS 17.3. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited.

item.title: CVE-2024-23255|2024-03-08T01:36:16.498Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: An authentication issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.4, iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4. Photos in the Hidden Photos Album may be viewed without authentication.

item.title: CVE-2024-23214|2024-01-23T00:25:34.993Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: Multiple memory corruption issues were addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.3, iOS 16.7.5 and iPadOS 16.7.5, iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-23243|2024-03-05T19:24:15.717Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: A privacy issue was addressed with improved private data redaction for log entries. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4. An app may be able to read sensitive location information.

item.title: CVE-2024-23238|2024-03-08T01:36:15.545Z -- Apple -- macOS
item.description: An access issue was addressed with improved access restrictions. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.4. An app may be able to edit NVRAM variables.

item.title: CVE-2024-23280|2024-03-08T01:36:14.625Z -- Apple -- tvOS
item.description: An injection issue was addressed with improved validation. This issue is fixed in Safari 17.4, macOS Sonoma 14.4, iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4, watchOS 10.4, tvOS 17.4. A maliciously crafted webpage may be able to fingerprint the user.

item.title: CVE-2024-23296|2024-03-05T19:24:13.999Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4. item.title: CVE-2024-23279|2024-03-08T01:36:13.690Z -- Apple -- macOS
item.description: A privacy issue was addressed with improved private data redaction for log entries. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.4. An app may be able to access user-sensitive data.

item.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in tvOS 17.4, iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4, watchOS 10.4. A malicious application may be able to access private information.

item.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Ventura 13.6.5, macOS Sonoma 14.4, iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4, watchOS 10.4, iOS 16.7.6 and iPadOS 16.7.6, tvOS 17.4. An app may be able to break out of its sandbox.

item.title: CVE-2024-23281|2024-03-08T01:36:10.006Z -- Apple -- macOS
item.description: This issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.4. An app may be able to access sensitive user data.

item.description: A race condition was addressed with improved state handling. This issue is fixed in tvOS 17.4, iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4, macOS Sonoma 14.4, watchOS 10.4. An app may be able to leak sensitive user information.

item.title: CVE-2024-23242|2024-03-08T01:36:08.176Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: A privacy issue was addressed by not logging contents of text fields. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.4, iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4. An app may be able to view Mail data.

item.description: An issue was addressed with improved handling of temporary files. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.3, watchOS 10.3, tvOS 17.3, iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3. An app may be able to access user-sensitive data.

item.title: CVE-2024-23203|2024-01-23T00:25:33.071Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: The issue was addressed with additional permissions checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.3, iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3. A shortcut may be able to use sensitive data with certain actions without prompting the user.

item.title: CVE-2024-23254|2024-03-08T01:36:07.243Z -- Apple -- visionOS
item.description: The issue was addressed with improved UI handling. This issue is fixed in tvOS 17.4, macOS Sonoma 14.4, visionOS 1.1, iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4, watchOS 10.4, Safari 17.4. A malicious website may exfiltrate audio data cross-origin.

item.title: CVE-2024-23223|2024-01-23T00:25:32.185Z -- Apple -- iOS and iPadOS
item.description: A privacy issue was addressed with improved handling of files. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.3, watchOS 10.3, tvOS 17.3, iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3. An app may be able to access sensitive user data.

item.description: The issue was addressed with improved authentication. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3. Stolen Device Protection may be unexpectedly disabled.

item.description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in visionOS 1.1, macOS Sonoma 14.4. Processing an image may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.description: A permissions issue was addressed with additional restrictions. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.4. An app may be able to access a user's Photos Library.

item.description: The issue was addressed with additional permissions checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.3, watchOS 10.3, iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3. A shortcut may be able to use sensitive data with certain actions without prompting the user.

item.title: CVE-2024-23245|2024-03-08T01:36:01.619Z -- Apple -- macOS
item.description: This issue was addressed by adding an additional prompt for user consent. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.4, macOS Monterey 12.7.4, macOS Ventura 13.6.5. Third-party shortcuts may use a legacy action from Automator to send events to apps without user consent.

item.title: CVE-2024-23300|2024-03-12T20:33:32.246Z -- Apple -- GarageBand
item.description: A use-after-free issue was addressed with improved memory management. This issue is fixed in GarageBand 10.4.11. Processing a maliciously crafted file may lead to unexpected app termination or arbitrary code execution.

item.description: A buffer overflow issue was addressed with improved memory handling. item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions. This issue is fixed in tvOS 17.4, iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4, macOS Sonoma 14.4, watchOS 10.4. An app may be able to access user-sensitive data.

item.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.3, watchOS 10.3, tvOS 17.3, iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3. An app may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in tvOS 17.4, macOS Sonoma 14.4, visionOS 1.1, iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4, watchOS 10.4, iOS 16.7.6 and iPadOS 16.7.6, Safari 17.4. Processing maliciously crafted web content may prevent Content Security Policy from being enforced.

item.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.4, macOS Monterey 12.7.4, macOS Ventura 13.6.5. Processing a file may lead to unexpected app termination or arbitrary code execution.

item.description: This issue was addressed with improved redaction of sensitive information. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.3, watchOS 10.3, tvOS 17.3, iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3. An app may be able to view a user's phone number in system logs.

item.description: An access issue was addressed with improved access restrictions. This issue is fixed in watchOS 10.3, tvOS 17.3, iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3, macOS Sonoma 14.3, iOS 16.7.5 and iPadOS 16.7.5, Safari 17.3. A maliciously crafted webpage may be able to fingerprint the user.

item.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.4, visionOS 1.1, iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4, watchOS 10.4, tvOS 17.4. Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.3 and iPadOS 17.3, Safari 17.3, tvOS 17.3, macOS Sonoma 14.3, watchOS 10.3. A malicious website may cause unexpected cross-origin behavior.

item.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.4, macOS Monterey 12.7.4, macOS Ventura 13.6.5. An app may be able to bypass certain Privacy preferences.

item.description: This issue was addressed with improved file handling. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.4, macOS Monterey 12.7.4, macOS Ventura 13.6.5. An app may be able to access sensitive user data.

item.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.4, macOS Monterey 12.7.4, macOS Ventura 13.6.5. An app may be able to modify protected parts of the file system.

item.description: The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.4, iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4. An attacker in a privileged network position may be able to inject keystrokes by spoofing a keyboard.

item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved state management.

item.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4. A user's locked tabs may be briefly visible while switching tab groups when Locked Private Browsing is enabled.
